sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"飞机"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: aeroplane, airplane, aircraft, plane, jet, helicopter
means: aeroplane和airplane专指普通飞机，不包括helicopter(直升飞机)。aeroplane为英国英语的拼法。
aircraft ：常用作集体名词，也可指一架飞机，其含义包括直升飞机和飞艇等。
plane ：本义为"平面"，在航空专业里通常用aeroplane。plane较通俗用词。
jet ：指喷气式飞机，也用jet plane。

word_mean: 平面：空间三个点所决定的平面
特定的平面，如麻醉平面
在腔壁或组织层次之间作表浅的切开，以便确定进入该腔或层次之间的精确部位，尤指成形手术时
可以不计地球曲面投影变形影响的描述小范围面积的地图。通常地图比例尺不应小于1∶5 000。
plane-parallel motion   专指刚体的一类运动。

sentence.Network_en: The plane has been kept in service far longer than originally intended.
sentence.Network_cn: 这架飞机已经超期服役很长时间了。

sentence.Network_en: He noticed that fabric was tearing away from the plane's wing.
sentence.Network_cn: 他注意到机翼在一块一块地断裂。

sentence.Network_en: The plane had been cleared for landing at Brunswick's Glynco Airport.
sentence.Network_cn: 飞机获准降落于不伦瑞克的格林科机场。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from Latin planum 'flat surface', neuter of the adjective planus 'plain'. The adjective was suggested by French plan(e) 'flat'. The word was introduced to differentiate the geometrical senses, previously expressed by plain, from the latter's other meanings
Middle English: from a variant of obsolete French plaine 'planing instrument', from late Latin plana (in the same sense), from Latin planare 'make level', from planus 'plain, level'
late Middle English: from Old French, from Latin platanus, from Greek platanos, from platus 'broad'

encyclopedia.content: 歌手简介 Jason Mraz 全名：Jason Thomas Mraz 中文名：杰森·玛耶兹 国籍：美国 生日：1977年6月23日 星座：巨蟹 身高：175cm 绰号：“男巫” 专辑： 2001年《Live and Acoustic 》 2002年《Waiting for My Rocket to Come》 2004年《Tonight, Not Again:Jason Mraz Live at Eagles Ballroom》 2005年《Mr. A-Z》 2008年《We Sing, We Dance, We Steal Things》 2009年《Live From Earth》 2010年 《life is good》 唱片公司：El

entry.def: A plane is a vehicle with wings and one or more engines, which can fly through the air.

example.ex: He had plenty of time to catch his plane...
example.tran: 他有足够的时间赶飞机。

example.ex: Her mother was killed in a plane crash.
example.tran: 她母亲在一次坠机中遇难。

entry.def: A plane is a flat, level surface which may be sloping at a particular angle.
If a number of points are in the same plane, one line or one flat surface could pass through them all.

example.ex: All the planets orbit the Sun in roughly the same plane, round its equator.
example.tran: 所有的行星大致在同一平面上绕太阳赤道运转。

entry.def: If you say that something is on a higher plane, you mean that it is more spiritual or less concerned with ordinary things.

example.ex: ...life on a higher plane of existence...
We felt we were living life on several different planes.
example.tran: 我们感到大家生活的精神层次各不相同。

entry.def: A plane is a tool that has a flat bottom with a sharp blade in it. You move the plane over a piece of wood in order to remove thin pieces of its surface.
If you plane a piece of wood, you make it smaller or smoother by using a plane.

example.ex: She watches him plane the surface of a walnut board...
example.tran: 她看着他刨平一块胡桃木板。

example.ex: Again I planed the surface flush.

entry.def: If something such as a boat planes across water, it moves quickly across the water, just touching the surface.

example.ex: All four of the boats planed across the Solent with the greatest of ease.
example.tran: 4艘船都极其自如地掠过索伦特海峡。

entry.def: A plane or a plane tree is a large tree with broad leaves which often grows in towns.

means.word_mean: 1. an aircraft that has a fixed wing and is powered by propellers or jets;

sentences.sentence: "the flight was delayed due to trouble with the airplane"
"we will refer to the plane of the graph as the X-Y plane"
"any line joining two points on a plane lies wholly on that plane"

means.word_mean: 3. a level of existence or development;
4. a power tool for smoothing or shaping wood
5. a carpenter's hand tool with an adjustable blade for smoothing or shaping wood;

sentences.sentence: "the cabinetmaker used a plane for the finish work"

means.word_mean: 1. cut or remove with or as if with a plane;

sentences.sentence: "The machine shaved off fine layers from the piece of wood"

means.word_mean: 2. travel on the surface of water
3. make even or smooth, with or as with a carpenter's plane;
1. having a horizontal surface in which no part is higher or lower than another;

Sentence.sentence: Finally, one day she got on a plane and went back to Brazil.
Well, I guess I'd sell my watch or computer or do some odd jobs till I could afford a return plane ticket.
When planes fall from the sky, as a Yemeni airliner did on its way to Comoros Islands in the India ocean June 30, 2009, the black box is the best bet for identifying what went wrong.
The German authorities are sending investigators to discover the cause of the plane crash late yesterday on the island of Tenerife.
What does the news say about the Boeing 737 plane?

sentences.en: They painted the underside of their planes with a black varnish.
sentences.cn: 他们在飞机的底部涂上了一层黑漆。

means.word_mean: 水平, 程度; 标准;（思想、存在或发展的）水平, 程度, 阶段, 境界

sentences.en: Keep your work on a high plane.
sentences.cn: 把你的工作保持在高水平上。

sentences.en: Parallel lines are, by definition, lines on the same plane that never join.
sentences.cn: 按照定义说, 平行线是在同一平面上永不相交的线。

jushi.english: Man is on a higher plane of development than the ape.
jushi.chinese: 人比类人猿处于更高的发展阶段。

jushi.english: If you plan ahead far enough, you can save a lot of money on your plane tickets.
jushi.chinese: 你们若能及早计划好,那么你们就能从飞机票上省下好多钱。

jushi.english: They seem to exist on a different spiritual plane.
jushi.chinese: 他们似乎生活在不同的精神境界。
